11 // These directives are used for determining what platform this code is being
12 // compiled for. While it may look at little strange that they are initially
13 // defined and then undefined again if they are not valid: this is done solely
14 // so correct Doxygen docs can be built for the preprocessor no matter what
15 // platform Doxygen is running from.
16

22 // clean up so code can still run as expected

25 #endif

32 // clean up so code can still run as expected

34  #undef CHAOS_OS_UNIX
35 #endif

82 #define CHAOS_DISALLOW_CONSTRUCTION( TypeName ) \
83  TypeName() = delete; \
84  TypeName( const TypeName& ) = delete; \
85  void operator=( const TypeName& ) = delete
